Defender,

Polar bear cubs could get the protection they need to survive thanks to a new bill. Tell your elected officials to support this legislation to save these bears!
Critical habitat for polar bears is threatened by Big Oil's planned industrial invasion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. These bears are already struggling to survive – reckless oil development could be the final nail in the coffin for the region's declining bear population.
Your representatives need to hear from you right now. Urge them to support this legislation to keep imperiled polar bears safe!

TAKE ACTION: Demand your elected officials protect vulnerable cubs by supporting the Polar Bear Cub Survival Act!

Friend of Defenders, a newborn polar bear cub only weighs about one pound. These cubs are completely dependent on their mother for nutrition and warmth. They are not strong enough to survive outside of their den.
But polar bears are in serious trouble. Many populations are in freefall: The Southern Beaufort Sea population that depends on the security of the habitat provided by the Arctic Refuge now numbers as few as 900 individuals – about half as many bears as three decades ago.
Oil exploration on the Refuge's coastal plain is a direct threat to these bears' survival. The Refuge is where pregnant mother bears go to build maternal dens and give birth. Seismic exploration for oil alone could lead to bears being crushed in their dens as 90,000-pound earthquake-inducing thumper trucks cause the bears' snow caves to collapse.
Don't let polar bears die for Big Oil's profits. Support legislation to keep these bears safe!

The Polar Bear Cub Survival Act, if passed, would create a buffer banning oil development around polar bear maternal denning habitat on the Arctic Refuge's coastal plain to ensure denning mothers and cubs are protected.
Congress needs to do what the Trump administration won't. They need to protect one of the most imperiled polar bear populations in the world from dangerous plans to industrialize their critical denning habitat.
Thank you in advance for your dedication to protecting wildlife.

Sincerely,
[Name]
[Position]
[Company]

Polar Bears Rescue

Subject: Our Team Has Rescued a Newborn Polar Bear!

Dear [NAME],

We are thrilled to present you with a very special news: our team rescued a newborn polar bear from the icy waters of the Arctic Ocean! The polar bear had been born just a few weeks ago, and we believe that she is extremely well-cared for. Her mother is still desperately searching for her, and we are hoping that she will soon find her way back to us.

This is an incredible opportunity for us, as we are now dedicated to caring for this newborn polar bear. She is currently receiving medical care and feeding, and her health is improving rapidly. We are confident that she will grow up to be a healthy and happy polar bear, just like her mother.

We are proud to announce that this new polar bear is now part of our team! We are also actively searching for her mother, and we are taking steps to ensure that she receives the best possible care for her baby.

We are writing to you today to share this heartwarming news with you, and to let you know that we are committed to your safekeeping and well-being. Your support is also needed to help us continue our work.

If you are able to help us in any way, please donate to our rescue fund to support our efforts. All donations will go directly towards the care and rehabilitation of the new polar bear.

We invite you to learn more about our organization and our mission to protect the Arctic and its animals. Please visit our website for more information: https://www.polarbearrescue.org.

Thank you for your support, and we hope to hear from you soon!

Best regards,

[Your Name]

Executive Director, [Organization Name]

Subject: Join the Fight to Save Polar Bears - Your Support Matters!

Dear [Recipient Name],

Imagine a world without polar bears. Their iconic white fur and powerful presence are a symbol of the untouched Arctic wilderness. But now, these majestic creatures are facing a threat that puts their very existence in jeopardy.

The rapid loss of Arctic sea ice, driven by climate change, is severely impacting polar bear populations. With only 26,000 to 31,000 polar bears remaining in the wild, their future hangs in the balance. These magnificent animals rely on sea ice for hunting seals, their primary food source. As the ice melts, polar bears struggle to find enough food to survive.

At [University of Sheffield], we are dedicated to preserving the natural world. Our Polar Bears Rescue project focuses on research, conservation, and advocacy to protect these iconic animals and their fragile habitat. We aim to raise awareness about the urgent need to address climate change and protect polar bears from extinction.

Here's how you can help:

1. **Make a Donation** - Your generous contribution will support our research projects, conservation efforts, and advocacy campaigns. Together, we can make a difference in the lives of polar bears.

2. **Spread the Word** - Share our message on social media using the hashtags #PolarBearsRescue and #SaveTheArctic. Help us raise awareness and inspire others to take action.

3. **Become a Volunteer** - Join our team of passionate conservationists and make a hands-on difference in the field. You can assist in data collection, community outreach, and more.

Your support is crucial in our fight to save polar bears. Every contribution, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. Join us in preserving the natural wonders of our planet and protecting these magnificent creatures for generations to come.

Together, we can ensure a future where polar bears thrive, and the Arctic remains a place of wonder and awe.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
[University of Sheffield]

[TEXT_END]
